system.description:
These goggles have a dragonshard in between the lenses, granting humans and half-orcs with a Lesser, Greater, or Siberys Mark of Finding the ability to see more clearly the imprinted aura of living creatures on objects as outlined below.

  • The wearer may make a Notice roll while using the Mark of Finding’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.sXrRk20IIFPhxkC0]{detect arcana} power to sense the aura of a creature who has touched a specific object. If the being is familiar to the wearer, the wearer knows who the owner of the aura is. If not, the wearer only knows the creature’s type. With a raise, the wearer also knows the gender and ancestry of the creature, and the wearer can ignore the −2 penalty when using locate on the target. The magic of the goggles is influenced by a creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.fK9adaURLKcCGv99]{shape change}, but the effects of @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.nz69DP0tjQGxYtcI]{disguise} and @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.RzVIX959WTYhdwwh]{illusion} are transparent.

  • While wearing the goggles, the wearer also gains a +1 bonus on Survival rolls to track the creature to which the aura belongs.

  • If the wearer uses the @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.JT9KsqEAHjZzfCg5]{locate} power of the Mark of Finding in an area through which the target has passed in the last 24 hours, he can see the path the target took.

  • The wearer gains a +2 bonus on all Spirit rolls to oppose a Performance or Persuasion roll made to deceive him.
